author: Staff Reporter
text:
To enthuse farmers to adopt advanced technologies for increasing productivity, the Department of Agriculture has commenced a ‘crop yielding competition’ for maize farmers in the district.

Joint Director of Agriculture A. Mahendran told The Hindu that the yield-wise performance of the farmers would be evaluated by a team of five judges and cash prizes given to top two finishers.

“Farmers have to attain a minimum yield of 2,000 kg an acre to be considered for the prize,” he added.

Apart from revenue and agriculture officials, the panel of judges has one progressive farmer.

A crop yield competition committee had been constituted to examine any disputes arisen on the declaration of prizes, official sources added.

At present, maize was cultivated over an expanse of 21,200 hectares in the district, said Mr. Mahendran.

title: Competition to enthuse farmers to increase yield
